Description

The Coordinator, Access and Retention Services, Springfield helps students achieve academically by coordinating and ensuring the delivery of academic support for students with disabilities as well as students in the Academic Engagement Program. The coordinator manages a caseload, conducts accommodation meetings, provides services and advocacy for students registered with the Office of Accessibility Services as mandated by Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act. This position works with students, faculty, and staff to support access to courses, programs, facilities, services, and activities. Incumbent must be able to exercise initiative and independent judgment in performance of duties.

RELATIONSHIPS AND CUSTOMERS

Other similar centers at two- and four- year institutions
Disabilities programs and/or staff at local area high schools and other higher education institutions
Community Agencies - Opportunities for Ohioans with
Disabilities, Ohio
Means Jobs
State & National organizations- SOCHE, Association on Higher Education and Disability

Outside specialists on supplemental instruction and/or independent learning
Textbook publishers and related instructional software for manufacturers
External organizations that focus on development and/or computer assisted education

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1.
Coordinates and ensures the delivery of the academic support services provided by the Access and Retention Services team, including, but not limited to, Office of Accessibility, the Engagement Program and provides support for the Testing Center as needed.

2.
Ensures students with disabilities have equal access to college programs by conducting intake interviews with students requesting accommodations, obtaining and interpreting documentation, and working collaboratively with faculty and staff to implement accommodations.

3.
Provides information, referral, and support to students with disabilities, and assists students in understanding their disabilities, rights, and responsibilities relating to reasonable accommodations.

4.
Maintains knowledge of current legislation and national, state, and local issues affecting access for students with disabilities.

5.
Provides academic support through academic coaching and creating an encouraging testing environment. .

6.
Manages alternative format book requests and maintains inventory of loan equipment. Educates students on usage of various accessibility technologies and services.

7.
Networks with community resources and institutions, such as local area high schools and career centers, national and local chapters of the Association on Higher Education and Disability, SOCHE, Ohio Means Jobs, and Opportunities for Ohioans with Disabilities to better serve students with disabilities.

8.
Provides general information regarding the enrollment process (i.e. admissions procedures, academic programs, and registration process).

9.
Works in a team-oriented environment, serving as an emissary between the regional locations and Springfield Offices, specifically with Retention Services.

10.
All other duties assigned by supervisor.


EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor's degree required; master's degree preferred
  • Three to five years' experience working in open learning environment, or in educational programming, or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience working with students with disabilities and knowledge of current legislation and national, state and local issues affecting access for students with disabilities.


SKILLS AND ABILITIES

  • Familiarity with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.
  • Approach each person through a trauma-responsive lens.
  • Ability to analyze requests for reasonable accommodations and for developing and implementing plans for the provision of reasonable accommodations.
  • Planning and problem-solving skills to apply to working with various populations
  • Ability to work with students in developing educational goals.
  • Experience working collaboratively in a group/team environment.
  • Ability to work effectively with people (staff, faculty, college leaders, prospective students and community stakeholders).
  • Ability to identify and solve problems; excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to coordinate multiple activities and schedules and to meet deadlines.
  • Ability to quickly learn adaptive technologies and various software applications, comfortable with word processing, spreadsheet, database, e-mail.
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume, fluid environment.
  • Preferred qualifications: master’s degree in education, counseling, or related field, experience with trauma-informed care, and experience with various information systems. The candidate should have experience with program development, implementation and coordination.

Definitions:

  • Trauma-responsive care: Trauma-responsive care is an approach that proactively removes barriers to create more accessible environments and systems by recognizing the traumatic impacts of various systems and experiences on students, caregivers, and families that prevent equal access to opportunities, equity, belonging, and safety.

Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or government regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals, Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, faculty, and students.

Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.

  • Madison Correctional Institution – London
  • Pickaway Correctional Institution – Orient
  • Trumbull Correctional Institution – Leavittsburg
  • Ohio Reformatory for Women – Marysville
  • Lebanon. Correctional – Lebanon
  • Warren Correctional – Lebanon
  • Allen Correctional – Lima
  • Pickaway – Orient
  • Correction Reception center – Orient
  • Southeastern correctional – Lancaster
